metadata.feature_description: Database schema and migration scripts for content layout data persistence.

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Extensions and locate Content Layout module
steps.expected: Content Layout module is listed with version information and In Use status
steps.actual: Content Layout module found: Version 10.1.1, In Use: Yes, Description: 'A module that allows add to a page a Dynamic Content Layout that can host other modules'

steps.action: Click on Content Layout to view extension details
steps.expected: Extension details page shows package information including version
steps.actual: Extension details displayed correctly: Name: ContentLayout, Friendly Name: Content Layout, Version: 10.1.1, Owner: DNN, Organization: DNN Corp.

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > SQL Console and execute query to find ContentLayout tables
steps.expected: Query returns ContentLayout_Versions table created by SQL Data Provider script
steps.actual: Query 'SELECT TABLE_NAME FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES WHERE TABLE_NAME LIKE '%ContentLayout%'' returned ContentLayout_Versions table

steps.action: View query results showing the table name
steps.expected: ContentLayout_Versions table exists in the database
steps.actual: ContentLayout_Versions table confirmed to exist - showing 1-1 of 1 items

steps.action: Execute query in SQL Console to find ContentLayout stored procedures
steps.expected: Query returns all CRUD stored procedures created by SQL Data Provider script
steps.actual: Query returned 6 stored procedures: ContentLayout_Versions_Add, ContentLayout_Versions_Update, ContentLayout_Versions_Delete, ContentLayout_Versions_Get, ContentLayout_Versions_GetAll, ContentLayout_Migration_UpdatePaneName

steps.action: View complete list of stored procedures
steps.expected: All 6 stored procedures defined in 08.02.00.SqlDataProvider are present
steps.actual: All 6 stored procedures confirmed present and correctly named as per the SQL script specifications

steps.action: Navigate to home page and verify Content Layout modules are working
steps.expected: Content Layout modules display correctly on the page, indicating database integration is working
steps.actual: Multiple Content Layout modules observed functioning correctly on the home page with pane structures: F30A_Pane1/Pane2, 9977_Pane1-4, 8F80_Pane1-2. Modules host other content modules (HTML Pro, image modules) successfully.

observations: SQL Data Provider Scripts are designed to execute automatically during extension installation/upgrade, not through direct UI interaction.

The 08.02.00.SqlDataProvider script creates: ContentLayout_Versions table with columns ModuleId, Version, ColumnSizes, ColumnCssClasses, AreCustomColumnSizes, IsPublished, CreatedOnDate, LastModifiedOnDate.
The script creates 5 CRUD stored procedures (Add, Update, Delete, Get, GetAll) plus 1 migration procedure (ContentLayout_Migration_UpdatePaneName).
The Uninstall.SqlDataProvider script properly defines cleanup procedures that will drop all stored procedures and the table when the extension is uninstalled.
Fresh installation and upgrade testing would require actually reinstalling the extension package, which is beyond standard UI testing scope.
The ContentLayout_Versions table has a foreign key relationship to the Modules table with CASCADE DELETE.
